metadata.Title: CVE-2023-34324 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: [linux/xen: Possible deadlock in Linux kernel event handling] Marek Marczykowski-Górecki discovered that the Xen event channel infrastructure implementation in the Linux kernel contained a race condition. An attacker in a guest VM could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (paravirtualized device unavailability).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
